reviewText: THE BLOOPERS OF THE DARK SHADOWS SOAP OPERA SERIES: It's an OK disc to collect if you are a big fan of the series, but if you are a general fan or take it or leave it fan don't bother. A lot of these bleeps were actually in the televised versions because it was live telecast in the 1960's to 1970's. Die-hard fans will love it. Good for the money if you just want to collect it for reference.

reviewText: Best with an icy bottle of Grolsch, sausages, sauerkraut, and mustard. And leaves falling from trees in Autumn's deepening gloom. Enjoy the Bloopers slightly tipsy, like the cameras and the actors' lines, and you'll get the maximum value out of this DVD. The rest disappoints, but for fans of the Gothic Masterpiece, who appreciate the delightful sum of its many parts, this is a must-have.

reviewText: If you are a die-hard Dark Shadows fan like I am, you must have this DVD!  I watched this classic gothic soap opera every day after school from 1966 to 1971.  I loved it and still do.  This bloopers and treasures disc is great because I had forgotten how many screw-ups there really were in this show, and somehow these consummate professional actors managed to get through them all.  Whether it's someone forgetting or messing up their lines or stage hands walking across the set during a scene or props malfunctioning or equipment hovering in plain view, this collection is hysterical and priceless.  It brought back a lot of fond memories, especially when I did happen to remember one of the bloopers, and it was great to see scenes from one of my all-time favorite shows again.
summary: CLASSIC STUFF FROM A CLASSIC SHOW!

reviewText: Very entertaining, bloopers and all.I very first saw this TV series in Alaska, around 1969-1971, while in Seward, for 2 yrs.There was only (1) TV station available there, and Dark Shadows was on around 5:00pm. I really got hooked on it. I think it would be neat if Dark Shadows was "reincarnated" again, in a daily series. Of course with diff. actors, actresses, but with the same story line.

reviewText: I grew up watching Dark Shadows and as a kid I never noticed the Bloopers.  When I got this DVD I watched it with my sister who also was a Dark Shadows fan and we laughed our heads off.  If you love Dark Shadows or if you just like good bloopers you will love this dvd.  My favorite part is where the character Barnabas Collins can't get rid of a fly that is on his nose!  Lots of fun and brings back lots of good memories.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Since "Dark Shadows" was recorded "live on tape" it meant that the show would start recording around 4pm in the afternoon and go through the entire 30 minute script hopefully without any mistakes. The reason way ABC refused to edit changes in the final cuts of the episodes was simply one of money. Nancy Barret who played Carolyn Stoddard once said that if actors made a mistake it was rarely if ever edited out, except in the case you fell down the stairs and broke your neck, but even then the network would give it thought.Unlike other soap operas of the day "Dark Shadows", thanks to creator Dan Curtis, had all its shows in their entirty, except one from 1971 so watching the series now is fun to see the various times actors forgot lines, booms and microphones appearing, sets falling down, and cameras going crazy and off to other directions when they were suppose to be on the actor. When one watches these bloopers you do get the feeling everyone from the directors to the actors and other crew members had one thing in common: to make "Dark Shadows" the best possible serial on the air and they did it, albeit with mishaps. I have watched many other soaps that have some of their episodes from the same period in tact and the same thing happened on "Another World", The Edge of Night" and "General Hospital". The reason "Dark Shadows" is known for their bloopers and mishaps is because of the sheer popularity of the series.The treasure part of this DVD features a plethora of goodies including an interview with Lara Parker who discusses the serial, various actors on game shows and much more.

reviewText: As a watcher of the show I remember many of the gaffs on the blooper reel but it was still amusing to watch. The additional items showing the cast doing other shows was also quite good.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I remember alot of the bloopers especially with Barnabas and Elizabeth Stoddard. Sometimes they flubbed their lines so badly that you couldn't understand what they said at all.I actually think it made this show more endearing to us fans. I know sometimes it made it more real because we all know that we don't speak perfectly in real life, so making mistakes was part of it's charm. I don't remember sets falling down, but I've pre-ordered the entire DS box set, so I can't wait to watch it all over again and this time get to see some of the mishaps that happened while filming.All in all I think for all  of us who watched the show in the 60's and 70's really enjoyed it because DS wasn't afraid to do many things that weren't possible, but that's what made it so much fun to watch.
Title: N/A
